intro: Sunipia soidaoensis, commonly known as the Soidao sunipia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
